column3: et abominábiles facti sùnt in stúdiîs suîs~; non èst qŭi fáciat bonum
column4: non èst usqŭe ad unum. ^ The fool hath said in his heart
column5: "There is no God". They are corrupt
column6: and are become abominable in their pursuits~; there is none that doth good

column1: 2 ^ Dòminus de caĕlo prospèxit super fílios hòminum
column3: aŭt requírens Deum. ^ The Lord hath looked down from heaven upon the children of men
column4: to see if there be any that understand and seek God.

column2: sìmul inútiles facti sùnt. Non èst qŭi fáciat bonum
column3: non èst usqŭe ad unum. ^ They are all gone aside
column4: they are become unprofitable together. There is none that doth good

column2: qŭi dévorant plebem meam sicut escam panis~? ^ Shall not all they know that work iniquity
column3: who devour my people as the food of bread~?

column1: 5 ^ Dòminum non invocavérunt~; illic trepidavérunt timóre
column2: ubi non èrat tìmor. ^ They have not called upon the Lord~; there have they trembled for fear

column1: 6 ^ Qŭóniam Dòminus in generatióne justa èst~; consìlium ìnopis confudìstis
column2: qŭóniam Dòminus spes ejus èst. ^ For the Lord is in the just generation~; you have confounded the counsel of the poor man
column3: but the Lord is his hope.

column1: 7 ^ ¿~Qŭìs dabit èx Sióne salutáre Israhélis~? Qŭum avèrterit Dòminus captivitátem plebis suaĕ
column3: et laĕtábitur Isráhel. ^ Who shall give out of Sion the salvation of Israel~? When the Lord shall have turned away the captivity of his people
